maml:description.maml:para: Checks the version of the module installed versus the version on GitHub
Checks the version of the module installed versus the version on GitHub
Get information on the Virus Total API key.

Get information on the Virus Total API key. The following information will be retrieved for the configured or specified API Key: 1. Type - if it is a private or public key. 2. Disabled_Until - if the key has been disabled it will provide until when it will be disabled. 3. Reques_rate - How many request can be performed per minute. 4. Monthly_Allowance - How many request can be executed per month. 5. Daily_Allowance - How many request can be executed per day.
Virus Total API key.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.
To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
Virus Total API key.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.
To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
Uses a proxy server for the request, rather than connecting directly to the Internet resource. Enter the URI of a network proxy server.

Specifies a user account that has permission to use the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter. The default is the current user.
Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain01\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.

Uses the credentials of the current user to access the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.
Virus Total API key.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.
To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
Uses a proxy server for the request, rather than connecting directly to the Internet resource. Enter the URI of a network proxy server.

Specifies a user account that has permission to use the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter. The default is the current user.
Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain01\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.

Uses the credentials of the current user to access the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.
Get a VirusTotal Report for a given Domain using the Public API
Get a VirusTotal Report for a given Domain that have been previously scanned.
Domain to scan.
VirusToral API Key.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.
To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.

Get a report about the behavior of the file when executed in a sandboxed environment using the Public API.

Virus Total runs a distributed setup of Cuckoo sandbox machines that execute the files we receive. Execution is attempted only once, upon first submission to Virus Total, and only Portable Executables under 10MB in size are ran. The execution of files is a best effort process, hence, there are no guarantees about a report being generated for a given file
The MD5/SHA1/SHA256 hash of the file whose dynamic behavioral report you want to retrieve.
Virus Total API key.
Full path and name for the report to be saved as.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.
To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
The MD5/SHA1/SHA256 hash of the file whose dynamic behavioral report you want to retrieve.
Virus Total API key.
Full path and name for the report to be saved as.

Retrieve a list of VirusTotal Community comments for a given file or URL using the Private API

Retrieve a list of VirusTotal Community comments for a given file or URL. VirusTotal Community comments are user submitted reviews on a given item, these comments may contain anything from the in-the-wild locations of files up to fully-featured reverse engineering reports on a given sample.
Either an MD5/SHA1/SHA256 hash of the file or the URL itself you want to retrieve.
Virus Total API Key.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.
To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.

Get a VirusTotal Report for a given File using the Public API

Get a VirusTotal Report for a given File that have been previously scanned. A MD5, SHA1 or SHA2 Cryptographic Hash can be provided or a ScanID for a File. Up to 4 file reports can be retrieve at the same time.
File MD5 Checksum, File SHA1 Checksum, File SHA256 Checksum or ScanID to query.
Virus Total API Key.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.

Get the scan results for a file using the Private API.
Get the scan results for a file.
An md5/sha1/sha256 hash of a file for which you want to retrieve the most recent antivirus report.
Virus Total API Key.

If specified and set to one, the call will return additional info, other than the antivirus results, on the file being queried. This additional info includes the output of several tools acting on the file (PDFiD, ExifTool, sigcheck, TrID, etc.), metadata regarding VirusTotal submissions (number of unique sources that have sent the file in the past, first seen date, last seen date, etc.), the output of in-house technologies such as a behavioral sandbox, etc.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.
To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Scan VirusTotal for information on a known malicious IP Address.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a special URL to upload files bigger than 32MB in size using the Private API.
Get a special URL to upload files bigger than 32MB in size.
Virus Total API Key.

To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
Virus Total API Key.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.
To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
Uses a proxy server for the request, rather than connecting directly to the Internet resource. Enter the URI of a network proxy server.

Specifies a user account that has permission to use the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter. The default is the current user.
Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain01\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.

Uses the credentials of the current user to access the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.
Virus Total API Key.

Uses the credentials of the current user to access the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.
Get a VirusTotal Report for a given URL using the Public API
Get a VirusTotal Report for a given URL that have been previously scanned. A URL or a Scan ID for previous scan. Up to 4 URL reports can be retrieve at the same time.
URL or ScanID to query.
VirusToral API Key.
Automatically submit the URL for analysis if no report is found for it in VirusTotal.

Read the VirusTotal API key saved on disk
Read the VirusTotal API key saved on disk provided the master password to decrypt it.
Delete a previously scheduled scan using the Private API.
Delete a previously scheduled scan.
An md5/sha1/sha256 hash of a file which you want to remove from periodic scanning.

Search for samples that match certain binary/metadata/detection criteria using the Private API.
Search for samples that match certain binary/metadata/detection criteria.
A search modifier compliant file search query. For an updated list of modifiers check https://www.virustotal.com/intelligence/help/file-search/
Virus Total API Key.

The offset value returned by a previously issued identical query, allows you to paginate over the results. If not specified the first 300 matching files sorted according to last submission date to VirusTotal in a descending fashion will be returned.

Virus Total API Key.
Virus Total API Key.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets a API key for use of functions in the module.

maml:description.maml:para: Post a comment on a file or URL using the Private API.
Post a comment on a file or URL.
Either an md5/sha1/sha256 hash of the file you want to review or the URL itself that you want to comment on.
Virus Toral API Key.
The actual review, you can tag it using the "#" twitter-like syntax (e.g. #disinfection #zbot) and reference users using the "@" syntax (e.g. @VirusTotalTeam).

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.
To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
Either an md5/sha1/sha256 hash of the file you want to review or the URL itself that you want to comment on.
Virus Toral API Key.
The actual review, you can tag it using the "#" twitter-like syntax (e.g. #disinfection #zbot) and reference users using the "@" syntax (e.g. @VirusTotalTeam).

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.
To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.

Either an md5/sha1/sha256 hash of the file you want to review or the URL itself that you want to comment on.
Virus Toral API Key.
The actual review, you can tag it using the "#" twitter-like syntax (e.g. #disinfection #zbot) and reference users using the "@" syntax (e.g. @VirusTotalTeam).

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.
To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
Uses a proxy server for the request, rather than connecting directly to the Internet resource. Enter the URI of a network proxy server.

Uses the credentials of the current user to access the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.

Uses the credentials of the current user to access the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.
Rescan a previously submitted file or schedule a scan to be performed in the future using the Private API.
Rescan a previously submitted file or schedule a scan to be performed in the future.

An md5/sha1/sha256 hash. You can also specify a CSV list made up of a combination of any of the three allowed hashes (up to 25 items), this allows you to perform a batch request with just one single call. Note that the file must already be present in our file store.
Virus Total API Key
Date in which the rescan should be performed. If not specified the rescan will be performed immediately.

Periodicity (in days) with which the file should be rescanned. If this argument is provided the file will be rescanned periodically every period days, if not, the rescan is performed once and not repeated again.

Used in conjunction with period to specify the number of times the file should be rescanned. If this argument is provided the file will be rescanned the given amount of times in coherence with the chosen periodicity, if not, the file will be rescanned indefinitely.
A URL to which a POST notification should be sent when the rescan finishes.
Used in conjunction with notify_url. Indicates if POST notifications should only be sent if the scan results differ from the previous one.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.
To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.

An md5/sha1/sha256 hash. You can also specify a CSV list made up of a combination of any of the three allowed hashes (up to 25 items), this allows you to perform a batch request with just one single call. Note that the file must already be present in our file store.
Virus Total API Key
Date in which the rescan should be performed. If not specified the rescan will be performed immediately.

Periodicity (in days) with which the file should be rescanned. If this argument is provided the file will be rescanned periodically every period days, if not, the rescan is performed once and not repeated again.

Used in conjunction with period to specify the number of times the file should be rescanned. If this argument is provided the file will be rescanned the given amount of times in coherence with the chosen periodicity, if not, the file will be rescanned indefinitely.
A URL to which a POST notification should be sent when the rescan finishes.
Used in conjunction with notify_url. Indicates if POST notifications should only be sent if the scan results differ from the previous one.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts.
To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
Uses a proxy server for the request, rather than connecting directly to the Internet resource. Enter the URI of a network proxy server.

Specifies a user account that has permission to use the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter. The default is the current user.
Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain01\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.

Uses the credentials of the current user to access the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.

Virus Total API Key

Periodicity (in days) with which the file should be rescanned. If this argument is provided the file will be rescanned periodically every period days, if not, the rescan is performed once and not repeated again.

Used in conjunction with period to specify the number of times the file should be rescanned. If this argument is provided the file will be rescanned the given amount of times in coherence with the chosen periodicity, if not, the file will be rescanned indefinitely.
A URL to which a POST notification should be sent when the rescan finishes.
Used in conjunction with notify_url. Indicates if POST notifications should only be sent if the scan results differ from the previous one.

File to submit to VirusTotal for scanning.
